articles.title: Argentina declares national holiday for World Cup celebration on Tuesday
articles.description: Argentina will celebrate their World Cup triumph on Tuesday in Buenos Aires at the Obelisk, with the government making it a national holiday.
articles.content:
Argentina's national team will celebrate their World Cup triumph on Tuesday in Buenos Aires at the Obelisk, the monument that is the traditional epicentre of sporting celebrations, the federation said on Monday.

articles.title: World Cup: French football team welcomed home after heroic defeat against Argentina
articles.description: Thousands gathered to greet the squad as they arrived home from Qatar and travelled into the heart of Paris on Monday night.
articles.content:
The French World Cup squad has been welcomed home by thousands of football fans following their dramatic defeat against Argentina.

articles.title: Argentina Wins Another World Cup. Now They Have a Chance to Fix Their Economy | Opinion
articles.description: Argentina—once one of the richest countries in the world—has become a corrupt, impoverished, rent-seeking society with chronic inflation of over 100 percent a year.
articles.content:
After 36 years, Argentina won another World Cup. In a country with a history of extraordinary players and where soccer is lived as a national religion, this was long overdue.
Also overdue are the structural reforms necessary for Argentina to fix its ... [4696 chars]
